head.title: Sally Hemings's Kin: The Past Is Not Past

hedline.hl1: Sally Hemings's Kin: The Past Is Not Past

abstract.p: Letter from Edna Bolling Jacques, descendant of Sally Hemings's sister, on May 14 article questions why Sally's descendants seek recognition by Thomas Jefferson's family

block.p: In ''Street-Name Plan Sparks a Jeffersonian Debate'' (news article, May 14), Dorothy Westerinen, a descendant of Sally Hemings, says, ''We want our family to recognize us, to embrace us.''
In ''Street-Name Plan Sparks a Jeffersonian Debate'' (news article, May 14), Dorothy Westerinen, a descendant of Sally Hemings, says, ''We want our family to recognize us, to embrace us.''
As a descendant of Mary Hemings, Sally's oldest sister, I am saddened to see Sally's descendants acting like grateful supplicants at the prospect of being recognized by the master's family.

Unlike the Jefferson family, which owns only a small graveyard at Monticello, my Hemings family owns hundreds of acres of land 50 miles south of Monticello with private graveyards intact since the 19th century.
In the 18th century, the Hemings family had no choice but to endure pain caused by the Jefferson family, but today we can dismiss them and their unpleasantness.
EDNA BOLLING JACQUES Chappaqua, N.Y., May 14, 2000
